objects.title: Fragment
objects.medium: Velvet, dyed warp
objects.creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

objects.title: Sample, "Microchek"
objects.medium:
Medium: rayon (61%) and nylon (39%)
Technique: plain weave
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 30.5 x 30.5 cm (12 x 12 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Alexander H. Girard
objects.description: Plain weave of brown, black and white in a subtle small checked pattern. Warp threads are brown and black. Weft threads are white. Number 1140.

objects.title: Sample, ca. 1949
objects.medium:
Medium: synthetic, cotton?
Technique: plain weave
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 18.5 x 24 cm (7 5/16 x 9 7/16 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of the Estate of Dorothy (Liebes) Morin
objects.description: Plain weave variation in which groups of six warps operate in plain weave with paired wefts and then the next six move up half a step for an alternate pairs of wefts, repeated across width. Warp has two shades of pink boucle alternating. Weft has stripes of chenille in two shades of green, the lighter shade paired with flat metal yarn.

objects.title: Sample Book, ca. 1857
objects.medium:
Medium: cardboard, paper, cotton
Technique: printed
objects.dimensions: H x W x D: 44 x 28 x 12 cm (17 5/16 in. x 11 in. x 4 3/4 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Virginia Hamill Johnson
objects.description: Green cloth bound volume of 1,823 samples of printed cottons mounted on paper. Title page marked "A1857." Many samples of miniature geometric and floral patterns and combinations of both forms. Larger pattern with border designs and warp stripes.

objects.title: Fragment, 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: block-printed on plain weave
objects.creditline: Gift of Salisbury Day from the Estate of Katharine Day
objects.description: Printing is in dull red and brighter red on natural ground.  Parallel stripes of dull red alternate with natural in which there are twining vines with leaves in the brighter red.  Colors are probably quite faded.

objects.title: Sample, "Millcheklet"
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton (63%) and nylon (37%)
Technique: double cloth
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 30.5 x 30.5 cm (12 x 12 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Alexander H. Girard
objects.description: Double cloth in a small-patterned blue and gray checkerboard. Warp threads are black and white. The weft threads are light blue and beige. Number 1131.

objects.title: Textile
objects.medium:
Medium: fiberglass
Technique: machine woven, gauze weave
objects.dimensions:
Warp x Weft (a): 181.6 x 118.1 cm (5 ft. 11 1/2 in. x 46 1/2 in.)
Warp x Weft (b): 43.2 x 52.1 cm (17 in. x 20 1/2 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Mr. Eric and Mrs. Sylvia Elsesser, The Trude Guermonprez Archives
objects.description: Off white casement fabric.

objects.title: Flounce, late 17th century
objects.medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: Brussels style bobbin lace
objects.creditline: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf Esq. in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
objects.description: Brussels-style flounce with references to liquid including a woman sitting on a storm cloud, two exotically dressed people watering a fruit tree and a woman giving her milk to a child holding a cup.

objects.title: Napkin, "Hawthorne: Design no. 528", ca. 1910
objects.medium:
Medium: linen (Quality no. 56)
Technique:  7 & 1 damask
objects.creditline: Museum purchase from Alice Baldwin Beer Memorial Fund
objects.description: Field: Closely spaced seeds of flowers. Border: Hawthorne blossoms hanging from a twined branch - a branch on both inner and outer edges of the borders rounding each corner. "DV" in each corner.

objects.title: Cravat End, 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: bobbin lace, Brussels style
objects.creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
objects.description: Cravat end of Brussels-style lace consisting of central floral motif surrounded by conventional palm and leaf forms. Fond: brides; Modes: réseau mouché, fond de neige, portes.

objects.title: Sampler, 1847
objects.medium:
Medium: wool embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross and eyelet stitches on plain weave foundation
objects.creditline: Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer
objects.description: Alphabets with signature and date in red and green.

objects.title: Unfinished Work, early 20th century
objects.medium:
Medium: linen, mercerized cotton
Technique: double running stitch embroidery on plain weave
objects.creditline: Gift of Mrs. Gino Speranza
objects.description: Linen cloth embroidered in red thread in the design of an angular stem with leaves and grapes.

objects.title: Textile, late 18th–early 19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: relief-printed
objects.creditline: Gift of Mrs. Rhea M. Knittle
objects.description: Floral stripe on a floral ground.

objects.title: Textile, ca. 1926
objects.creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor

objects.title: Ornament, ca. 1900
objects.medium:
Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk
Technique: needle lace, looping (buttonholing) over a metal-wrapped thread
objects.creditline: Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer
objects.description: Fleur de lys form.

objects.title: Fragment, 17th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: 4 and 1 harness satin damask
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 16.5 x 10.3 cm (6 1/2 x 4 1/16 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
objects.description: Diagonally slanting floray scrolls and tiny sea creatures in blue and white.

objects.title: Sampler, 1842
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton and silk
Technique: embroidered in cross stitches on plain weave foundation;  bound on all sides with red silk ribbon
objects.creditline: Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer
objects.description: Five alphabets and two sets of numerals in red on white ground.  School diploma on back.

objects.title: Shawl Border, early 19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: wool, silk
Technique: tapestry woven
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 62.5 x 140 cm (24 5/8 x 55 1/8 in.)
objects.creditline: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund
objects.description: Horizontal row of large stylized decorated cones with leafy edges; broad guard border on four sides consisting of octagonal medallions, each framing floral spray, and oak leaves between. Broad border at top with a row of decorated mounds with flowery sprays growing on and in them. Small cypress shape in center of each and between each. Great variety of colors on white ground.

objects.title: Textile, 1750–1800
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: block printed on plain weave (black, two reds, two purples, two blues, and dark yellow)
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 81 x 58 cm (31 7/8 x 22 13/16 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Josephine Howell
objects.description: Ribbon-like stripes in yellow and red alternate with intersecting s-curves of lace and floral chains.

objects.title: Fragment, late 17th–early 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: damask, supplementary weft
objects.creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
objects.description: Fragment of green silk damask brocaded in gold and red. Pattern depicts hunter, cupid shooting a bird, rayed head.

objects.title: Fragment, 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: crewel wool on cotton 
Technique: embroidered in chain stitch (needle-made), knots and satin stitch on 2/2 twill weave
objects.creditline: Gift of Mrs. H.P. Davison
objects.description: Piece of crewel embroidery in colored wool yarns with scattered motifs in a grid arrangement. The motifs do not repeat in a regular manner but alternate a floral motif (eight different ones, sometimes facing in different directions) with an animal or bird motif (eight different ones). Different colors are used when a motif is repeated.

objects.title: Patchwork Cover, ca. 1910
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, cotton
Technique: chromolithography printed on 7 & 1 satin, stitching
objects.creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Smith
objects.description: Patchwork cover made of cigarette souvenir squares printed with national flags, famous queens and fashionable women. Backed with roller printed cotton with design of roses.

objects.title: Embroidered Picture, ca. 1670
objects.medium:
Medium: silk and metallic thread embroidery on silk foundation
Technique: satin stitches and detached needle looping on satin weave
objects.dimensions: Frame H x W x D: 54.9 x 45.1 cm (21 5/8 x 17 3/4 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Myra M. and William H. Mathers
objects.description: Two sides of a stumpwork casket, in raised and padded embroidery with gold bobbin lace trimming.

objects.title: Fragment, 17th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: damask with supplementary weft
objects.creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
objects.description: Green satin background with pattern – much worn away – of floral shapes in polychrome.

objects.title: Letter Case, 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk and metallic thread embroidery on silk foundation
Technique: embroidered on satin foundation
objects.creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
objects.description: White silk embroidered in floral designs with borders.

objects.title: Purse, late 17th–early 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, metal
Technique: woven
objects.creditline: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf
objects.description: Small envelope-shaped case. Very faded and soiled rose color with a woven design in silver. Symmetrical stylized design of flowers and foliage. Lined with cream white taffeta. Has been edged with very narrow silver braid which remains under one flap.

objects.title: Embroidered Picture, 1948
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: stem, long and short, satin and couching stitches on warp-faced plain weave
objects.inscribed: on paper label pasted to back in Marian Hague's handwriting, "Worked by a patient of th Metropolitan Hospital in the Occupational Therapy Department 'Social Service' 1948".
objects.creditline: Bequest of Marian Hague
objects.description: Waterfront scene of New York showing small ship and store fronts in foreground with skyscrapers behind them.

objects.title: Sample, "One-Way", 1953
objects.medium:
Medium: 100% linen
Technique: printed on plain weave
objects.markings: Paper label attached to lower right corner.  HERMAN MILLER FABRICS
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 30.5 x 30.5 cm (12 x 12 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Alexander H. Girard
objects.description: Varying sized triangles, all facing one direction and randomly placed to form a pattern. White triangles outlined in black are printed on natural color.

objects.title: Textile
objects.medium: Technique: relief printed
objects.creditline: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund

objects.title: Sample, "Tweed"
objects.medium:
Medium: linen blend
Technique: plain weave
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 27.9 x 30.5 cm (11 x 12 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Alexander H. Girard
objects.description: Vertically striped plain weave in black, light brown and white. Warp threads are black, light brown and white. Weft threads are white. Number 5.041

objects.title: Textile, "Study for Houses on a Street", 1939
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: tapestry woven (double interlocked with extended dovetailing for shading)
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 24.1 x 24.1 cm (9 1/2 x 9 1/2 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Lydia Van Gelder
objects.description: Woven sample of sylized houses in white, black and grey for larger hanging "Houses on a Street."

objects.title: Livery Trimming, 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: velvet
objects.creditline: Gift of Mrs. DeWitt Clinton Cohen
objects.description: Design of a sailing ship in white and black on a red ground, a band showing three fleur-de-lys in yellow on blue ground, and a crown in black and white on a yellow ground.

objects.title: Sampler, 17th century
objects.medium:
Medium: linen embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in withdrawn element work with needle-made fillings on plain weave foundation
objects.creditline: Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer
objects.description: Two bands of withdrawn element work in white.

objects.title: Roundel, 15th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, gold thread
Technique: embroidery
objects.creditline: Gift of Irwin Untermyer
objects.description: Five small roundels embroidered in colored silks and gold.  Three illustrate scenes from the legend of St. Catherine of Alexandria; two others scenes from the life of St. Martin.

objects.title: Sampler, 1789
objects.medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross stitch on plain weave foundation
objects.inscribed:
Abigail Adams her work New York
1789
objects.provenance: ex. coll. Mrs. Henry E. Coe (Eva Johnston Coe)
objects.creditline: Bequest of Mrs. Henry E. Coe
objects.description: The field has scattered motifs including house, a peacock, urns of flowers, birds, and Adam and Eve with the Tree of Knowledge. Surrounded on three sides with a geometric border and on all four with a strawberry vine border. With the date 1789 at the top and the inscription Abigail Adams her work New York at the bottom.

objects.title: Sample, ca. 1953
objects.medium:
Medium: synthetic fiber  
Technique: plain weave with warp floats
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 17.1 x 25.4 cm (6 3/4 in. x 10 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of the Estate of Dorothy (Liebes) Morin
objects.description:
Open plain weave with 3 span floats of every 4th warp on shed A & B. Paired and unpaired warps are in a variety of yarns in white, gold and silver.
Warp: repeating pattern of white flake yarn, transparent chained plastic, wrapped silver yarn, wrapped gold yarn paired with 2 ply gold yarn. 
Weft: chained transparent plastic, alternating wtih white boucle yarn; flat, wrapped and braided silver; flat wrapped and braided gold yarn.

objects.title: Bag, 1750–1800
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, metal
Technique: stem, running and knot stitches using attached coils of gilt wire and gilt spangles. Trimmed with floral vine made of dyed silks bound to wire.
objects.creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
objects.description: Woman's bag of white taffeta, embroidered in colored silks, metal thread and sequins. On one side, children playing game of "la main chaude;" on the other, woman offering grapes to a child. Faces painted. Edged with elaborate trimming of silk flowers.

objects.title: Purse, late 17th–early 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, metal
Technique: woven
objects.creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
objects.description: (a) Envelope-shaped purse in blue-green silk brocaded in silver and gold with rose silk. Bird under canopy with confronted rampant lions. (b) Blue silk brocaded in silver. Basket of flowers, center, with symmetrical floral border.

objects.title: Textile, 1935–37
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: hand woven 2/2 twill with bands of complementary weft patterning; the floats of the complementary weft are attached to the back by a supplementary warp
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 242 x 123 cm (7 ft. 11 1/4 in. x 48 7/16 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of the Estate of Dorothy (Liebes) Morin
objects.description: Unbalanced plaid of white, green and orange with yellow, lavender and black.

objects.title: Textile, 1818
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave
objects.creditline: Gift of Mary S.M. Gibson
objects.description: Architectural scene with trees and clouds. Printed in mauve on tan background. Signed MAADER SCULP.

objects.title: Textile, 1750–1800
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: mordants for 2 reds, purple and black applied by pen and brush; madder dyed; blue and yellow added by brush; chintz on plain weave
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 60.5 x 33 cm (23 13/16 x 13 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Josephine Howell
objects.description: Lace-like bands and floral stripes.

objects.title: Fragment, 17th century
objects.medium:
Medium: linen, cotton 
Technique: plain weave with supplementary weft
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 15 x 31.8 cm (5 7/8 x 12 1/2 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
objects.description: Supplementary blue weft floating alternatively face to face creating a pattern of quatrefoil rosettes.

objects.title: Textile, "Diane Chasseresse", ca. 1800
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: copperplate printed on plain weave
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft (a): 87 x 94 cm (34 1/4 x 37 in.)
objects.creditline: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment
objects.description: Classical figures in medallions and plaques depicting domestic scenes with cows and Diana with her dog. Brown on white.

objects.title: Patchwork Cover, ca. 1910
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, cotton
Technique: chromolithography printed on 7 & 1 satin, stitching
objects.creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Smith
objects.description: Patchwork cover made of cigarette souvenir squares printed with national flags and birds. The large central flag is from pre-revolutionary Russia and is surrounded by birds and other national flags. Several flag souvenirs read "Zira Cigarettes." Backing is a roller-printed cotton with a design of roses. Edged in silk hairpin lace.

objects.title: Textile, "Nucleus", 1976
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton 
Technique: double cloth (two interlocked plain weave structures)
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft (selvedge to selvedge): 47.6 x 43.2 cm (18 3/4 x 17 in.)
objects.creditline: Museum purchase from Friends of Textiles Fund
objects.description: Small scale checkerboard pattern in multiple solid and mixed colors, using close values and hues to create optical illusions at various distances.

objects.title: Sample, ca. 1945
objects.medium:
Medium: wool, rayon and synthetic yarns, plastic strip
Technique: plain weave
objects.creditline: Gift of the Estate of Dorothy (Liebes) Morin
objects.description: Woven sample mounted to a cardboard card with notations by the designer. Horizontal stripes of green, red, pink and clear plastic. Warp is clear plastic strips alternating with plied beige yarn. Weft is of red bouclé, paired beige twisted and untwisted yarn, pink chenille, red untwisted yarn, and two different green plied yarns.

objects.title: Textile, "La Foire du Caire", ca. 1790
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved copper plate on plain weave
objects.creditline: Gift of W. and J. Sloane
objects.description: Four vignettes showing scenes in a Middle Eastern city. Purple on white.

objects.title: Textile
objects.medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: embroidered
objects.creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

objects.title: Bag, 1837
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, glass beads
Technique: embroidered with beads
objects.creditline: Gift of Harvey Smith
objects.description: Small bag fringed with blue beads and topped with fold-over flap of patterned brocaded taffeta. Rows of simple designs of stars, flowers, dogs. The name Sally Exnights? and Watersbourough, 1837 are worked into the embroidery.

objects.title: Palampore, late 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: mordant-painted and resist-dyed (chintz)
objects.creditline: Museum purchase from Restricted Funds
objects.description: Half of a palampore with a tree trunk in brilliant light red rises from a mound and curves heavily right before branching toward the top. Various flowers in brilliant red and dull violet with leaves in two shades of blue with red accents appear. Vestiges of yellow remain in leaves of small flower clusters. To left of the curved trunk appears a half medallion formed from ribbon knots and flowers framing a cluster of roses. The mound is comprised of pointed hillocks in reds, blues, and browns with much shading. A pheasant in many colors is perched on a short plant rising from the mound, and a small flowering tree is at the right end. Birds in branches are babblers. Finishing the right side and top, a border about twelve inches wide is composed of narrow festoons of ribbon and small flower clusters, and an outer festoon simulating a pale rose-colored ribbon with flower clusters at each curve in reds, blue, and pale violet. A narrow band of red is painted along the edge at the right side and across the top.

objects.title: Textile Samples, ca. 1919
objects.medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: printed on chiffon
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 106.7 x 109.3 cm (42 x 43 1/16 in.)
objects.creditline: Anonymous bequest in memory of Albert and Rebecca Elsberg
objects.description: Samples of printed chiffon, each with a white ground and a design of circles and geometric motifs with interspaces filled with angular floral and foliate motifs.

objects.title: Sample, ca. 1950
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton and synthetic fiber
Technique: 2/2 twill with designated warps pulled up for pile (velvet)
objects.inscribed: in ink on card "NY91", "Dorothy Liebes" and "c.1950".
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 18.5 x 20 cm (7 5/16 x 7 7/8 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of the Estate of Dorothy (Liebes) Morin
objects.description: Blocks of pile (uncut loops) in stripes of pink and brown.

objects.title: Textile
objects.medium: Technique: cutwork
objects.creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

objects.title: Sample, "Tweed"
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton (59%) and jute (41%)
Technique: plain weave with doubled warps
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 30.5 x 30.5 cm (12 x 12 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Alexander H. Girard
objects.description: Tweed effect plain weave in black, beige and white. Beige and white warp threads are paired. Weft threads are black. Number 019.

objects.title: Miser's Purse, early 19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, metal
Technique: crocheted
objects.creditline: Gift of Mrs. Albert Blum
objects.description: Crocheted dark brown silk ornamented with cut steel beads in geometric pattern.  Two cut steel rings control side opening; steel pendant at each end.

objects.title: Fragment, early 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, metallic thread
Technique: embroidered
objects.creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
objects.description: Fragment depicting a vase of flowers resting on the ground with a bird in the foreground.

objects.title: Fragment, early 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, metallic thread
Technique: embroidered
objects.creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
objects.description: Fragment depicting a basket of flowers resting on the ground with a bird and flowers in the foreground.

objects.title: Fragment, ca. 1740
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, metallic thread
Technique: plain weave with a set of supplementary warps (orange) and discontinuous supplementary wefts (silks and metallics) bound on the front in 1/3 twill
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 97 x 11.5 cm (38 3/16 x 4 1/2 in.)
objects.creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
objects.description: Long narrow fragment from the right side of a pattern which had a ship at sea and bold vegetation in bright colors and metallic thread.

objects.title: Textile
objects.creditline: Anonymous bequest in memory of Albert and Rebecca Elsberg

objects.title: Bag, early 17th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk and metal-wrapped silk on linen
Technique: embroidery using cross, half-cross, back and eyelet stitches in silk; buttonhole, plaited braid, looping and knotted stitches using metal-wrapped silk on plain weave
objects.creditline: Bequest of Marian Hague
objects.description: Three panels plus base, each with a different pattern, sewn together. Extended dark yellow silk lining functions with a drawstring as a closure.

objects.title: Fragment, 17th century
objects.medium:
Medium: linen, cotton 
Technique: plain weave with supplementary weft
objects.creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
objects.description: Supplementary blue weft floating alternatively face to face creating a design of birds flanking a rosette.

objects.title: Purse, 19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, glass beads, steel
Technique: beaded knitting
objects.creditline: Gift of Mrs. Hollis French
objects.description: Cut steel frame ornamented with flowers; bag worked in colored beads with design of landscape with hunter, stag and dog surrounded by floral and geometric borders. On the reverse, the same except the landscape shows a house with a dog. Long steel chain, lined with satin.

objects.title: Sample, ca. 1948
objects.medium:
Medium: synthetic and cotton fibers
Technique: 2/2 twill weave with supplementary weft
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 25.4 x 29.2 cm (10 in. x 11 1/2 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of the Estate of Dorothy (Liebes) Morin
objects.description:
2/2 twill with supplementary weft loops (slip loop with an extra wrap). 
Warp: white 3 ply cotton string alternate with beige yarn. 
Weft: 3 rows of white synthetic paired with flat gold metallic alternate with 2 rows beige chenille.

objects.title: Purse, late 17th–early 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, metal
Technique: woven
objects.creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
objects.description:
(a) Red silk with symmetrical patterning in silver. Paired hearts flanked by cupids above crown with monkeys right and left. Parrots in corners above, peacock below, dogs in foliage. 
(b) Blue silk with symmetrical woven pattern in silver. A heart surmounted by a cipher flanked by falcons. Above a crown, border of stylized foliage.

objects.title: Cap, 19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: linen, wool
Technique: satin stitch embroidery on plain weave, bobbin lace
objects.creditline: Gift of Mrs. Henry J. Bernheim
objects.description: Woman's cap embroidered in characteristic design of open flowers and birds with floral sprays in beaks.

objects.title: Textile
objects.medium: Technique: printed
objects.creditline: Anonymous bequest in memory of Albert and Rebecca Elsberg

objects.title: Livery Trimming, mid-19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: voided velvet
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 30.7 x 12.7 cm (12 1/16 x 5 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Mrs. DeWitt Clinton Cohen
objects.description: Design of the arms Mexico alternating with French imperial crown set between borders with diamond-shaped ornaments. In brown on a white ground. Probably made for Maximilian, Emperor of Mexico.

objects.title: Sampler, mid-19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: wool embroidery on cotton foundation
Technique: embroidered in cross, satin, long-armed cross wth knotted raised stitches on plain weave foundation
objects.creditline: Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer
objects.description: Initials in center, three raised areas of pattern.

objects.title: Sample, "Linstripe"
objects.medium:
Medium: linen (96%) and cotton (4%)
Technique: vertical bands of plain weave joined by long weft floats
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 31.8 x 30.5 cm (12 1/2 x 12 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Alexander H. Girard
objects.description: Vertical bands of plain weave in beige are joined together by long off-white weft floats. Bands give a stripe effect. Number 428.

objects.title: Pendant, 20th century
objects.medium:
Medium: beads, leather
Technique: beads embroidered to leather backing
objects.creditline: Bequest of Marian Hague
objects.description: Circular pendant in a design of concentric circles worked in seed beads of yellow, blue, light blue, pink and black.

objects.title: Sample, "Plusses", 1959
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed on twill weave
objects.markings: Herman Miller paper label attached to lower right corner.
objects.creditline: Gift of Alexander H. Girard
objects.description: Brown plus signs printed on off-white ground in off set rows.  Serged on two sides and cut on two sides.

objects.title: Sampler, probably late 19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in double running, stem, cross, satin, and long armed cross stitches on plain weave foundation
objects.creditline: Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer
objects.description: Bands of pattern arranged horizontally and vertically.

objects.title: Livery Trimming, 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: voided velvet
objects.creditline: Gift of Mrs. DeWitt Clinton Cohen
objects.description:
Component A is on a white ground with the coat of arms of a bishop. A shield with arms is capped with a mitre, cross and pastoral staff (crosier). These are framed by the ecclesiastical hat that has tassels falling on either side of the shield. 

Component B has shield of arms underneath a cardinal's hat with tassels that fall on either side of the shield.

objects.title: Border, 20th century
objects.medium: Technique: machine made
objects.creditline: Gift of Emily Finch
objects.description: Band with a pattern of flowers and a basket of fruit inspired by motifs from the mid-eighteenth century.

objects.title: Textile, late 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: plain weave foundation. Block-printed: 2 reds, 2 purples, yellow, brown and blue
objects.creditline: Gift of Josephine Howell
objects.description: Part of a design of tree trunk and large scale flowers. Two pieces (each with a selvedge) seamed.

objects.title: Textile
objects.medium: Technique: knitted
objects.creditline: Bequest of Erskine Hewitt

objects.title: Sampler, 1668
objects.medium:
Medium: linen and silk
Technique: embroidered
objects.creditline: Bequest of Emily Coe Stowell from the Coe Collection
objects.description: Floral vines in bands.  Alphabet in two bands at bottom.  Signed SUSAN EVE 1668.

objects.title: Textile
objects.creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

objects.title: Table Cover, 19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: block-printed on plain weave
objects.creditline: Gift of Alice B. Beer
objects.description: Small square table cover, pieced, of cream-color cotton block-printed in reds, violet, and green.  Corner design of large flowers and foliage; small all-over pattern of little buds.  Narrow floral border.  Green is blue over yellow.

objects.title: Textile, "Double 'S'", 1956
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: block printed on plain weave
objects.inscribed: Double 'S' Amanda Hand Print (printed in selvedge)
objects.creditline: Gift of Helen A. Haselton
objects.description: Geometric design with black lines and green rectangles and squares. Heavy black lines create a linear design suggestive of a Greek key motif. In the background are green-shaded rectangles and squares surrounded by hatch marks that suggest shading. Printed from blocks cut by the designer.

objects.title: Textile
objects.medium: Technique: relief-printed
objects.creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. G. Glen Gould

objects.title: Textile, "Morreau", introduced 1989
objects.medium:
Medium: polyester
Technique: jacquard woven
objects.creditline: Gift of Knoll Textiles
objects.description: Curved bands in greens and gold that overlap and intersect.

objects.title: Patchwork Cover, ca. 1910
objects.medium:
Medium: silk, cotton
Technique: chromolithography printed on 7 & 1 satin, stitching
objects.creditline: Gift of Mr. and Mrs. Stephen Smith
objects.description: Patchwork cover made of cigarette souvenir silk squares printed with national flags, figures in national dress, and bathing beauties. Pink cotton backing fabric.

objects.title: Sample, "Milmix"
objects.medium:
Medium: rayon (68%) and cotton (32%)
Technique: plain weave
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 29.8 x 30.5 cm (11 3/4 x 12 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Alexander H. Girard
objects.description: Weft-faced plain weave in light brown, white and black. The light brown and white weft threads give the predominant color. There are black warp threads which appear on the surface. A black binding warp is visible on the reverse. Number 1188.

objects.title: Cuffs, early 18th–19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton on linen
Technique: deflected element work
objects.creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
objects.description: Pair of openwork cuffs, each in the shape of a trapezoid. Each cuff has a design of a cartouche enclosing a ribbon tied bouquet of flowers and an ornamental scroll at the bottom.

objects.title: Purse, 19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: glass beads, metal
Technique: beaded knitting
objects.creditline: Gift of Mary S. M. Gibson
objects.description: Knitted bag with colored glass beads in a design of a rose with forget-me-nots in an eight-pointed star on a blue ground; finished at bottom with blue bead fringe and at top with a metal frame ornamented with cut-out floral designs and engraving.

objects.title: Embroidered Picture, late 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: satin weave, embroidered with silk floss and hand-painted
objects.creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
objects.description: Landscape showing a stream with rocks, trees, grass and a bridge; two women fishing, one wading in the stream. In a border of blue satin with urns, vines, birds in oval medallions, scrolls, etc.

objects.title: Textile
objects.creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf

objects.title: Sampler, late 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: linen embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: embroidered in cut, withdrawn, and deflected element work with pattern darning and needle-made fillings on plain weave foundation
objects.creditline: Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer
objects.description: Whitework sampler.  Sixty-four squares of pattern darning, cutwork with needle-made fillings.  Withdrawn element work and deflected element work.

objects.title: Towel Fragment, 17th–18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: twill patterned with supplementary wefts
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 14 x 54.6 cm (5 1/2 x 21 1/2 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of John Pierpont Morgan
objects.description: Band from a Perugia towel with a pattern of a fountain with confronted stags.

objects.title: Embroidered Picture, late 19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: wool embroidery on cotton foundation, with glass beads and metal sequins
Technique: embroidered in cross and raised stitches on plain weave foundation; beads sewn on individually and in pre-strung strands
Embroidered
objects.creditline: Bequest of Gertrude M. Oppenheimer
objects.description: Bird flying over three raised-work roses in a field of glass beads.

objects.title: Textile, ca. 1835
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: engraved and relief roller printed on plain weave; red, brown and black printed by engraved roller; yellow and blue printed by a relief roller
objects.creditline: Gift of Harold M. Bailey
objects.description: Polychrome panel with a vertical arrangement of flower bouquets of roses and passion flowers with foliage. Set off against vertical background stripes of small S-curves within foliage. Staggered repeat.

objects.title: Textile, 1775–95
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: printed by engraved plate on plain weave
objects.dimensions:
Warp x Weft (a): 186.7 x 63.5 cm (6 ft. 1 1/2 in. x 25 in.)
Warp x Weft (b): 184.8 x 63.5 cm (6 ft. 3/4 in. x 25 in.)
objects.creditline: Bequest of Elinor Merrell
objects.description: Two selvedge to selvedge widths with design of a diagonal chinoiserie fence enclosing flowers and exotic figures in turbans smoking pipes.

objects.title: Sampler, 1723
objects.medium:
Medium: silk and linen embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: spaced running (pattern darning), four-sided and cross stitches on plain weave foundation. Darning interlaces in one direction only.
objects.dimensions: H x W x D: 32 x 33 cm (12 5/8 x 13 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
objects.description: Eighteen examples of pattern darning in a grid arrangement signed "Marie Terese Fourbisseur.  Anno 1723."

objects.title: Fragment, second half of 18th century
objects.medium:
Medium: silk
Technique: embroidery on satin weave
objects.creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
objects.description: Design: Upright stem with flowering branches, and architectural motif (partly cut away).

objects.title: Sample, "Woolway"
objects.medium:
Medium: wool (38%), cotton (32%), linen (15%), and rayon (15%)
Technique: plain weave
objects.dimensions: Warp x Weft: 30.5 x 30.5 cm (12 x 12 in.)
objects.creditline: Gift of Alexander H. Girard
objects.description: Textured plain weave in black, white and light brown. Warp is comprised of heavy black and white yarns, shiny threads in white, and thin threads in light brown. Weft is comprised of thick white yarns. Number 65.

objects.title: Textile
objects.medium: Technique: printed
objects.creditline: Gift of W. and J. Sloane

objects.title: Towel, late 19th century
objects.medium:
Medium: cotton, silk, metal thread
Technique: embroidery, drawnwork
objects.creditline: Gift of Henry G. Dwight
objects.description: Cotton towel with ends embroidered in silks and metal thread. Design appears to be house with groups of towers at side. Worked entirely in drawnwork, embroidered over in colors; parts outlined in flat metal and metal thread.

objects.title: Fragment
objects.medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: block printed pigment on plain weave
objects.creditline: Gift of John Pierpont Morgan
objects.description: Ogives in staggered horizontal rows in black on tan.

objects.title: Textile
objects.medium: Technique: relief printed
objects.creditline: Museum purchase from Au Panier Fleuri Fund
